column5: One of the local weathermen mentioned smoke from forest fires in Canada is made its way to central Illinois? I heard from the crew at Black Bear Lodge on Red Lake, they had some fires in the region? Any news?
Pretty much guaranteed to have forest fires scattered all across the Boreal Forest every June until Oct.

This interactive map shows the current active fires. There are a couple west of ear falls and red lake. They are small. The big one is north of red lake and is currently 3000 hectare or about 7500 acres.https://www.ontario.ca/page/forest-fires
No doubt! Recent updates say the smoke is coming from Alberta!

NP. I few years back we flew out of red lake and right into a gigantic smoke cloud. For quite awhile we didn't know which way was up or down. The pilot finally did a u-turn and went back to red lake. After we were on the ground he admitted that even he was a little worried on that one. Since then, I tend to keep track of the active fires up there!
YIKES!!! That would get my attention too! A couple of years ago on Red Lake fishing out of Black Bear Lodge, a couple of guys got a free shower thanks to the a practice run from a water bomber!
Fires have forced the evacuation of the residents of Pikangikum first nation about 90 Km. north of Red Lale.
